About me

ðŸ‘‹ Iâ€™m Eileen, and I care about usable security. I work for Simply Secure as a program associate, where I help others think about designing for privacy, security, and transparency. I like breaking things down, juggling ideas, and writing up my thoughts in flow charts. I believe that openness matters.

Previously, I was part of the team behind Code for Germany and the Prototype Fund. We explored ways to make a difference with technology, both through community organising and funding for open source projects. My focus was on communication and content.

I studied Philosophy at Trinity College, Cambridge and Logic at the Institute for Logic, Language and Computation in Amsterdam. I contribute to the Open Logic Project.

I am originally from Berlin, where I attended the John F. Kennedy School.

I love Duke Ellington & Billy Strayhorn. I hate raisins.

If you want to collaborate on a project, why not get in touch?
